snippet: Tom Perkins may have apologized for comparing attacks on the wealthy in the United States to Kristallnacht. But his core argument about class warfare found a supporter in Samuel Zell, the real estate tycoon.
abstract: Tom Perkins may have apologized for comparing attacks on the wealthy in the United States to Kristallnacht. But his core argument about class warfare found a supporter in Samuel Zell, the real estate tycoon.

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. DE LA MERCED

headline.main: Zell Backs Tom Perkins's Arguments About Class Warfare
